abstract.p: Fallon McElligott takes top honors with most awards at One Show for creative excellence in advertising sponsored by One Club for Art and Copy; other winners noted (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Fallon McElligott, part of Publicis S.A., took top honors with the most awards at the One Show for creative excellence in advertising sponsored by the One Club for Art and Copy.

At the 24th annual ceremony, held last night in New York, the London, Minneapolis and New York offices of Fallon won 14 awards, called Pencils, for work for clients like Sports Illustrated, part of the Time Inc. unit of Time Warner Inc., and the United States Tennis Association. The Best of Show award went to the New York office of Fallon, known as Fallon McElligott New York City, for work for the FX Network, part of the Fox Network unit of the News Corporation.
Fallon McElligott, part of Publicis S.A., took top honors with the most awards at the One Show for creative excellence in advertising sponsored by the One Club for Art and Copy.

At the 24th annual ceremony, held last night in New York, the London, Minneapolis and New York offices of Fallon won 14 awards, called Pencils, for work for clients like Sports Illustrated, part of the Time Inc. unit of Time Warner Inc., and the United States Tennis Association. The Best of Show award went to the New York office of Fallon, known as Fallon McElligott New York City, for work for the FX Network, part of the Fox Network unit of the News Corporation.
Other multiple winners were Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., with seven awards; Crispin Porter & Bogusky in Miami, with six; and Cliff Freeman & Partners in New York, with five.

THE MEDIA BUSINESS: ADVERTISING -- ADDENDA Correction: May 13, 2000, Saturday An entry in the Addenda listing on the Media Business page yesterday about the One Show awards for creative excellence in advertising misstated the number won by two runner-up agencies. Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., won 11 awards, not 7; Cliff Freeman & Partners in New York won 9, not 5.
